content: 3 sts purl-wise wyif turn work row 212 rs k until 3 sts from end including colourwork from chart slip the last 3 sts purl-wise wyif turn work all following odd numbered/ws row as per row 211 all following even numbered/rs row as per row 212 cut cc almost black & cc red 1 leaving tails to sew in later stitch count 3 + 101+ 3 = 107 stitch count at widest part of shawl on row 210 3 + 104 + 3 = 110 copyright 2024 suzi ashworth for folkestone harbour yarn day 12 pansy row 195 - 203 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge + left edge increase pattern as row 9 & 10 knit until row 203 introducing cc purple 2 cc yellow 1 & cc green 1 as needed refer to colourwork tips section for a reminder of 3 stranded knitting tricks if needed the pansy motif is 14 stitches wide and is repeated 6 times across the width of the scarf with the final 2 flowers on the left edge being knitted form the chart place stitch markers every 14 sts as appropriate cut cc purple 2 cc yellow 1 & cc green 1 leaving tails to sew in later stitch count 3 + 100+ 3 = 106 this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way day 11 lily of the valley row 183 - 194 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge + left edge increase pattern as row 9 & 10 knit until row 194 introducing cc blue 1 & cc green 2 as needed the lily of the valley motif is 10 stitches wide and is repeated 9 times across the width of the scarf place stitch markers every 10 sts as appropriate cut cc blue 1 & cc green 2 leaving a tail to sew in later rejoin mc white stitch count 3 + 96+ 3 = 102 copyright 2024 suzi ashworth for folkestone harbour yarn day 10 snail row 169 - 182 continuing to knit in the same i cord edge + left edge increase pattern as row 9 & 10 knit until row 182 introducing cc variegated brown 1 as needed all gardeners know that if you plant hostas snails will not be far away love them or hate them these common garden snails are an essential part of every english garden the snail motif is 21 stitches wide and is repeated 3 times across the width of the scarf with the 4th snail closest to the increase edge being knitted from the chart place stitch markers every 21 sts as appropriate cut cc variegated brown 1 leaving a tail to sew in later stitch count 3 + 90+ 3 = 96 this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way day 9 hosta row 157 -
